body.p: This guide describes how to secure a Greenplum Database system. The guide consists of the following sections:

ul.li: lists network ports and protocols used within the Greenplum cluster.
describes the available methods for authenticating Greenplum Database clients.
describes how to restrict access to database data at the user level by using roles and permissions.
describes Greenplum Database events that are logged and should be monitored to detect security threats.
describes how to encrypt data in the database or in transit over the network, to protect from evesdroppers or man-in-the-middle attacks.
provides steps for configuring Greenplum Database to access external tables in a Hadoop cluster secured with Kerberos.
provides steps for securing Greenplum Database hosts and the cluster.

body.p: This guide assumes knowledge of Linux/UNIX system administration and database management systems. Familiarity with structured query language (SQL) is helpful.

Because Greenplum Database is based on PostgreSQL8.3.23, this guide assumes some familiarity with PostgreSQL. References to PostgreSQL documentation are provided throughout this guide for features that are similar to those in Greenplum Database.
This guide provides information for system administrators responsible for administering a Greenplum Database system.
